## Warehouse Project Complexity Factors

::: {style="margin: 48px 0;"}
### Understanding Your Project Scale

::: {style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(300px, 1fr)); gap: 24px; margin: 32px 0;"}

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Standard Single-Unit Warehouse
**Size:** 5,000 - 20,000 sqm  
**Height:** 10-12m clear  
**Complexity:** Low-Medium  
**Timeline:** 3-4 days  
**Typical Cost:** £600-900/sqm

**Characteristics:**
- Single tenant
- Standard steel frame
- Basic cladding & roofing
- 5-10 loading docks
- Minimal office space
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Multi-Unit Distribution Center
**Size:** 20,000 - 50,000 sqm  
**Height:** 12-15m clear  
**Complexity:** Medium-High  
**Timeline:** 5-6 days  
**Typical Cost:** £700-1,100/sqm

**Characteristics:**
- 2-4 tenant spaces
- Automated racking systems
- Enhanced fire protection
- 15-25 loading docks
- Mezzanine office areas
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Large-Scale Fulfillment Hub
**Size:** 50,000 - 100,000+ sqm  
**Height:** 15m+ clear  
**Complexity:** High  
**Timeline:** 6-7 days  
**Typical Cost:** £800-1,500/sqm

**Characteristics:**
- Single mega-tenant
- Automation infrastructure
- Complex MEP systems
- 50+ loading docks
- Extensive office/amenity space
:::

:::
:::

## Key Cost Drivers in Warehouse Projects

::: {style="margin: 48px 0; padding: 32px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-radius: 8px;"}
### Typical Cost Breakdown (per sqm)

::: {style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 32px; margin: 24px 0;"}

::: {style=""}
#### Structural Elements (40-45%)
- Steel frame: £180-250/sqm
- Concrete floor slab: £80-120/sqm
- Foundations: £60-100/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £320-470/sqm
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Envelope (20-25%)
- Wall cladding: £60-90/sqm
- Roof covering: £50-80/sqm
- Loading dock equipment: £30-50/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £140-220/sqm
:::

::: {style=""}
#### MEP Services (15-20%)
- Electrical distribution: £40-60/sqm
- Lighting: £25-40/sqm
- Heating/ventilation: £30-50/sqm
- Fire protection: £20-35/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £115-185/sqm
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Other Elements (15-20%)
- External works: £50-80/sqm
- Preliminaries (12-15%): £85-150/sqm
- Contingency (5-10%): £40-80/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £175-310/sqm
:::

:::

::: {style="text-align: center; margin-top: 32px; padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-charcoal); border-radius: 8px;"}
<h3 style="color: #FFFFFF; margin-top: 0;">Total Typical Range: £750-1,185/sqm</h3>
<p style="color: #FFFFFF; font-style: italic;">(Excluding land, fees, and client fit-out)</p>

<p style="color: #FFFFFF;"><strong>NOTE:</strong> Actual costs vary significantly based on:</p>
<ul style="color: #FFFFFF; text-align: left; display: inline-block;">
<li>Location and ground conditions</li>
<li>Height and clear span requirements</li>
<li>Automation and racking systems</li>
<li>Fire protection standards</li>
<li>Tenant specification level</li>
</ul>
:::
:::

## Our Warehouse Estimation Process

::: {.process-steps}
::: {.process-step}
#### Initial Review & Setup

**Day 1 (4-6 hours)**

**What We Do:**
- Review BIM model (IFC/Revit) or 2D drawings
- Verify structural grid and bay sizes
- Confirm clear height requirements
- Identify tenant-specific requirements
- Set up repetitive element libraries

**Client Provides:**
- Architectural & structural drawings/models
- Specification documents
- Site information
- Any tenant fit-out requirements

**Output:** Project plan and timeline confirmation
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Automated Quantity Extraction

**Days 1-2**

**What We Do:**
- Extract all structural elements automatically
- Quantify cladding and roofing systems
- Calculate foundation volumes
- Count loading docks and doors
- Measure floor areas and wall lengths

**Technology:**
- BIM 5D extraction tools
- Repetitive element automation
- Cross-checking with 2D documents

**Output:** Complete quantity take-off (BOQ)
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Cost Application & Analysis

**Days 2-4**

**What We Do:**
- Apply current market rates
- Factor in project location
- Include logistics considerations
- Calculate preliminaries (12-15%)
- Add appropriate contingency (5-10%)
- Run alternative scenarios if requested

**Database Sources:**
- BCIS (UK) / Rawlinsons (Australia)
- Live supplier quotes
- Recent project benchmarks

**Output:** Detailed cost estimate with breakdown
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Quality Review & Reporting

**Days 4-5**

**What We Do:**
- Technical peer review
- Check against benchmarks
- Verify calculations
- Prepare visual cost breakdown
- Create executive summary
- Schedule presentation/meeting

**Deliverables:**
- Executive summary (2-3 pages)
- Detailed cost breakdown by element
- BOQ with quantities and rates
- Cost per sqm analysis
- Alternative scenarios (if requested)

**Format:** PDF + Excel workbooks
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Presentation & Handover

**Day 5-7**

**What We Do:**
- Present findings to project team
- Explain key cost drivers
- Review any value engineering options
- Discuss any risks or assumptions
- Answer questions
- Provide ongoing support

**Meeting Options:**
- In-person (UK only)
- Video conference (all locations)
- Written Q&A via email

**Support:** 30 days post-delivery included
:::
:::

::: {style="text-align: center; margin: 32px 0; padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-radius: 8px;"}
**Typical Total Duration:** 5-7 working days from BIM model receipt to final report  
**Express Service:** Available for urgent projects (3-4 days) at 25% premium
:::

## Frequently Asked Questions

::: {.faq-section}
::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What's the largest warehouse project you've estimated?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We've worked on distribution centers up to 150,000 sqm single-tenant facilities and multi-unit parks totaling 300,000+ sqm. No project is too large for our 5D BIM workflow.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you handle pre-engineered building systems (Butler, Kirby, etc.)?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Absolutely. We have extensive experience with all major pre-engineered building systems including Butler, Kirby, Astron, Rubb, and Frisomat. Our cost databases include standard configurations for these systems.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: How quickly can you provide a budget estimate for planning purposes?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: For a planning-stage budget estimate based on concept drawings, we can typically provide a cost range within 1-2 days. This uses benchmarks and parametric estimating rather than detailed take-offs.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What if the client changes the clear height requirement after your estimate?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Because we work with 5D BIM, we can quickly re-calculate the cost impact of height changes, typically within a few hours. This includes structural implications, cladding adjustments, and MEP modifications.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Do you include automated material handling systems in your estimates?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We can include allowances for automated storage and retrieval systems (ASRS), conveyor systems, and sortation equipment. For complex automation, we typically work with specialist suppliers to get accurate budgets.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you provide cost breakdowns by zone for phased construction?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Yes, we regularly prepare cost breakdowns by construction phase or tenant zone. This is particularly useful for speculative development where different units may be built or fitted out at different times.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: How do you handle site-specific conditions like poor ground?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We rely on the client's ground investigation reports to assess foundation requirements. For poor ground conditions, we include appropriate foundation solutions (piling, ground improvement, etc.) based on the geotechnical recommendations.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What's your fee structure for warehouse projects?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Fees vary based on project size, complexity, and timeline. As a rough guide:
- Small warehouse (5,000-10,000 sqm): £3,000-5,000
- Medium warehouse (10,000-30,000 sqm): £5,000-8,000
- Large warehouse (30,000-50,000 sqm): £8,000-12,000
- Mega facility (50,000+ sqm): £12,000-20,000

Express service (3-4 days) carries a 25% premium. Contact us for a specific quote.
:::
:::
:::
